mocafe.fenut.parameters

Parameters

Class representing the simulation parameters.

mocafe.fenut.parameters.from_dict(parameters: dict)

Creates a Mocafe Parameters object from a Python dictionary.

The structure of the Python dictionary must be:

param_dict = {
    "name_param_a": <value_param_a>,
    "name_param_b": <value_param_b>,
    ...
}
Parameters

parameters – the parameters dictionary

Returns

the Parameters object

mocafe.fenut.parameters.from_ods_sheet(file: pathlib.Path, sheet: str)

Creates a Mocafe Parameters object form a sheet of an .odf file.

The given sheet must have at least to columns: name, with the parameters’ names; and sim_value, with the value of the parameters. Any other column, for instance containing the measure units, the reference of the parameters, or other informations, will be stored inside the Parameters object and used for reporting informations, but are not compulsory.

Parameters

  • file – file path

  • sheet – sheet of the file to be used to load parameters

Returns

the Parameters object

class mocafe.fenut.parameters.Parameters(param_df: pandas.DataFrame)

Class representing the simulation parameters.

It is basically a wrapper for a pandas.DataFrame, which contains everything about the simulation parameters.

get_value(self, name: str)

Get the parameter value from the given name.

Parameters

name – parameter name

Returns

the value of the parameter with the given name.

set_value(self, name: str, new_value)

Set a value for the parameter of the given name.

Parameters

  • name – parameter name

  • new_value – the new value for the parameter

Returns

Get the pandas.DataFrame representing the Parameters object

Returns

the dataframe representing the Parameters object

is_value_present(self, name)

Check if the parameters object contains a value for the parameter of the given name

Parameters

name – the name of the given value

Returns

True if a value is present for the given parameter name; False otherwise.

is_parameter(self, name)

Check if the given parameter name correspond to a parameter inside the parameters object

Parameters

name – the name of the putative parameter

Returns

True if there is a reference for the given parameter, False otherwise
